answers.answer: I am not an expert and by no means should you take my advice as such, but what you are describing sounds a lot like a panic attack--especially when diarrhea follows.  Are you a nervous person?  You don't have to answer that on this forum, only to yourself.  If all of your tests in the ER were fine, were you relaxed afterward?  A panic attack can be really devastating if you have never had one.The only thing that would make me think otherwise would be your eyelid swelling--do you have any seasonal or food allergies?  Does your doctor treat you for low blood pressure?I wouldn't think it was a brain tumor first, I would want to know about the shortness of breath and eyelid swelling.Are you taking any medications, either prescribed or over-the-counter?  You can have a reaction to a medication at any time, not when you first begin them.  II would talk to your primary care doctor and find out about your meds (if you are on any)--DO NOT stop taking any medications unless directed by a licensed physician treating you.Good Luck to you.

question: I'm 40 year old female. About 10 days ago I started to have shortness of breath, heart palpitation and dizziness. I also have mild headache and eyelid itch/swelling for about a month. They all come and go. But when a bad course of the symptoms come I feel almost faint. It lasts about 30 minutes to 1 hour but sometimes I stay sick the rest of the day with a little dizziness and shortness of breath. Also at the end of this attack sometimes I feel like I'm getting diarrhea. It seems to happen more in the morning when I'm driving.About 5 days ago new symptoms started. Thirst, frequent urination and lower back pain.I was drinking water all day but after urination or bowel movement I felt more dizzy, off balance,  shaky and lower backache was worse. With other symptoms I got scared and went to ER. They tested my blood, urine and chest X-ray. Everything was normal (not anemic, no sign of diabetes) except I was little dehydrated. After ER I got bad headache for 3 days and had to take aspirins.I also saw a cardiologist and he thought my heart was fine but scheduled for Echo Stress test.My medical history includes mild Barrett's esophagus (taking Protonix for a year), fairy large thyroid nodule (biopsy negative, TSH - a little higher side but normal range and T4 normal, size hasn't been changed much), ovarian cyst surgery in March, 06 (lost right ovary).I have had the bad course of attack a few times in the past. Also after my surgey I had shortness of breath, chest tightness and dizziness for a while. My blood pressure is always lower side.My primary physician ordered thyroid scan but I'm more worried about brain tumor or pituitary gland problems. Please help!!!
title: Brain Tumor?
